newsitem.title: ITALY: Agip, Schlumberger in software deal.
newsitem.headline: Agip, Schlumberger in software deal.

text.p: Italian state controlled energy group ENI's Agip SpA oil exploration unit and Schlumberger Ltd on Wednesday signed a memo of understanding to develop and market joint software.
The software, making use of a geographic interactive system, will be capable of handling data storage, retrieval and cartographic displays on Internet/Intranet environment.
The agreement was signed during the Offshore Mediterranean Conference taking place here.
Agip said in a statement it has developed its in-house Corporate Data Management solution, GIS Forall, that the Italian company is using in domestic activity and around the world.
Schlumberger, through its operating unit GeoQuest, has already been providing data management services and software products based on the Finder family of products since 1990.
Under the agreement, the first release of the software is foreseen by the end of 1997.
Another Agip/Schlumberger joint venture has been realised, the Dipfan software, a package for dipmeter interpretation, which will be marketed by Schlumberger-GeoQuest.
